Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.output

Class DuckDBWriter.QueueConnection

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.DuckDBWriter.QueueConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Enclosing class:
DuckDBWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
public class DuckDBWriter.QueueConnection extends Thread
Inner class that manages the database connection and record flushing in a separate thread. The QueueConnection continuously checks for new records in the queue and flushes them to the database. It also handles shutdown signals and ensures that all records are flushed before closing the connection. The class provides synchronization mechanisms to manage waiting for new records and to signal the thread to wake up when new records are added or when a shutdown signal is received.

  • Constructor Details

    • QueueConnection

      public QueueConnection(File file, Class<X> type, String name) throws SQLException, IOException
      Initialises a new QueueConnection for writing to a DuckDB database. Sets up the database file and creates the appropriate table schema based on the provided class type. The thread will continuously flush records from the queue to the database until halted.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to which the DuckDB database will be written; if the file already exists, it will be deleted and recreated
      type - the class type of the records to be written; used to generate the appropriate SQL table schema
      name - the name of the table to be created in the DuckDB database for storing the records
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error connecting to the DuckDB database or executing the table creation SQL
      IOException - if there is an error deleting or creating the database file

  • Method Details

    • flush

      public void flush()
      Flushes the queue to the database. This is called by the thread's run loop

    • halt

      public void halt()
      Halts the writer thread, signaling it to stop processing and flush any remaining records in the queue to the database before closing the connection. If the thread is currently waiting for new records, it will be notified to wake up and complete the shutdown process.

    • isWaiting

      public boolean isWaiting()
      Checks if the writer thread is currently waiting for new records to be added to the queue. This can be used to determine if the writer is idle or actively processing records.
      Returns:
      true if the writer thread is waiting for new records, false if it is actively processing the queue

    • report

      public String report()
      Reports the current status of the writer thread, indicating whether it is waiting for new records or actively writing to the database.
      Returns:
      a string indicating the current status of the writer thread; returns "empty" if the thread is waiting for new records, and "writing" if it is actively processing the queue

    • run

      public void run()
      The main run loop of the writer thread. Continuously checks for new records in the queue and flushes them to the database. If the queue is empty, the thread will wait until it is notified of new records or a shutdown signal. When a shutdown signal is received, the thread will flush any remaining records and close the database connection before exiting.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • submit

      public void submit(Object[] item)
      Submits a record to the queue for writing to the database. If the writer thread is currently waiting for new records, it will be notified to wake up and process the queue.
      Parameters:
      item - the record to be added to the queue, represented as an array of objects corresponding to the columns of the database table
